header: COFFEE WAS DISCOVERED BY AN ETHIOPIAN GOAT HERDER
text: The stimulating effects of coffee were discovered by a goat herder in Ethiopia who noticed that his goats were particularly alert after consuming berries from a coffee tree.

Bees are the main pollinators of coffee plants. The way coffee plants reproduce is by producing very sweet nectar-like flowers that are pollinated by bees. The flower also contains caffeinated nectar.

header: COFFEE USED TO BE CONSUMED IN RELIGIOUS CONTEXTS
text: Coffee drinking declined in popularity after it was banned by religious authorities in Mecca and Cairo during the 16th century. The ban was soon lifted due to pressure from large merchants who profited from the coffee trade.

header: Brazil is the world's largest coffee producer
text: According to the International Coffee Organization, Brazil now produces about a third of the world's coffee supply, roughly twice as much as the runner-up, Vietnam.
